Both were very bad mid 1980's scifi movies that feature a girl who fantasizes about robots (like Wall-e) making her life better. The only difference was that in America 3000, her boyfriend comes along as his role is diminished.

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy live in the mountains, under ominous guard against the "peons". Sister Ruby decides to travel to the mountains for some food supplies and learns disharmonious tactics face her as she becomes infatuated with one of the guards. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to catch the wave of martial arts popularity ; It borrows many characteristics from other better Ninja and Karate films such as Big trouble in Little China, and it is acted like a Schwarzenegger vehicle with low budget effects .
